thread.title: Moussa Dembele to snub Chelsea, Arsenal and Real Madrid to see out four-year Celtic deal, according to agent
thread.title_full: Moussa Dembele to snub Chelsea, Arsenal and Real Madrid to see out four-year Celtic deal, according to agent

author: gsweet
title: Moussa Dembele to snub Chelsea, Arsenal and Real Madrid to see out four-year Celtic deal, according to agent
text:
EFL STAYING PUT Moussa Dembele to snub Chelsea, Arsenal and Real Madrid to see out four-year Celtic deal, according to agent 
Former Fulham hitman has fired 27 goals this season to alert Europe's finest but he's happy to stay at Celtic Park By GEOFF SWEET Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MOUSSA DEMBELE plans to honour his four-year deal at Celtic amid speculation that he is on the radar of a host of top European clubs, including Real Madrid. 
Dembele has scored 27 goals in all competitions since joining from Fulham last summer and his agent, Mamadi Fofana, insists the France youth international only has eyes for Celtic Park. PA:Press Association Goal machine…Moussa Dembele has scored 27 goals for Celtic 
Arsenal and Chelsea are also thought to be on Dembele’s trail. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Celtic news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But Fofana insisted: “Moussa doesn’t stress. He signed a four-year deal at Celtic and, in his head, he’ll be at Celtic for those four years. 
“If he has to leave, that will happen at the right time, but it’s not in Moussa’s head nor my head. In January, there was speculation, but there will always be speculation if he does well. Moussa Dembele shows Chelsea what they’re missing after firing deadly 24-minute hat-trick against St Johnstone 
"It's good. It means we are all doing well. The boy is doing well, Celtic are doing well and we as agents are doing the right things for everyone – but it's so important to focus on the right things. Related Stories OUR Kids are alright Marcus Rashford, Tom Davies and Ryan Sessegnon named in the top 30 Under-20s stars in Europe Bon Appetit Chelsea and Manchester City ready to return for Leonardo Bonucci following his huge bust-up with boss STRIFE OF RYAN Man Utd icon Ryan Giggs believes 'too many foreign managers' are restricting Brits' chances in Premier League London Calling Everton star Romelu Lukaku drops not-too-subtle hint at Chelsea return with Champions League tweet mowst wanted Blackburn Rovers announce Tony Mowbray as new head coach after Owen Coyle departure mad dog put down Martin Allen sacked by National League big-spenders Eastleigh after just two wins in 14 games in charge 
"Moussa remains cool. He's not affected. I am not even thinking of the future. I don't wake up in the morning thinking where Moussa will go in the summer. The future does not exist. The past has gone. 
"It's about being a better player right now. The plan with [manager] Brendan [Rodgers] and the club and Moussa is private, but I can say it will remain the same and it stays the same." News Group Newspapers Ltd Dembele is on the radar of top European teams Getty Images But the ex-Fulham man is happy at Celtic 
Fofana told the Daily Record that the move to Celtic has been highly beneficial for Dembele. 
He added: " We are there for the boy to become a better player , for the club to achieve more things and the club wants to keep their best players. Watch the moment Celtic superfan Jay Beatty greets Moussa Dembele in French 
"If Celtic ever wants to sell Moussa, it will be a common decision which is taken between everyone."
